title: Hugely popular, pro-aspiration, and at a bargain price: the Tories should slash stamp duty
text:
The looming election will of course be dominated by Brexit. But as we saw in 2017, domestic priorities have a nasty habit of making themselves known.

The Government already has a clear agenda: supporting frontline services (the NHS, police, schools) and investing in infrastructure. But where else should it target its fiscal firepower?

The ideal would be to find a tax cut that is hugely popular. Which helps fix a pressing social problem. Where the benefits far outweigh the cost to the Treasury. And whose economic impact means that it largely pays for itself.

What is this miracle measure? The answer is simple: slashing the cost of stamp duty.
